other_tests.findings: Moderate amount of free fluid in the left anterior pararenal space extending down the left paracolic gutter, small amount of perihepatic free fluid, moderate amount of free fluid in the right paracolic gutter extending down to the right lower quadrant. Loss of normal texture of the pancreas, dilated pancreatic duct up to 5.3 mm in the neck region and up to 5.6 mm in the pancreatic head. Possible ampullary stricture. Two pancreatic cysts, one measuring 8 mm in the tail and another measuring 5 mm in the neck, both communicating with the central pancreatic duct. CBD measuring 8.5 mm at the porta hepatis tapering down to 6.6 mm in the pancreatic head with mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation. Incidental findings include fundal focal adenomyomatosis of the gallbladder and a round 3.8-cm fluid collection in the right cardiophrenic angle.
